We need to produce a summary of the functionality of the code snippet. The snippet is from modin/polars/groupby.py GroupBy. It defines a method sum that returns a DataFrame. It uses self.df.__constructor__ to construct a new DataFrame from a query compiler that performs groupby_sum on the underlying data. It passes parameters: self.by, axis=0, groupby_kwargs dict(sort=not self.maintain_order, as_index=True), agg_args empty, agg_kwargs dict(numeric_only=True), drop=False. Then resets index. There's a TODO comment about non-numeric columns being dropped vs converted to null in Polars.

Thus the business logic: groupby sum operation on a DataFrame, grouping by columns in self.by, preserving order based on maintain_order flag, returning a DataFrame with sum of numeric columns, non-numeric columns dropped. Input: self (GroupBy object) with attributes df (DataFrame), by (group keys), maintain_order flag. Output: a new DataFrame with summed values per group.
